metadata.title: CVE-2020-19909 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
** DISPUTED ** Integer overflow vulnerability in tool_operate.c in curl7.65.2 via a large value as the retry delay. NOTE: many parties report thatthis has no direct security impact on the curl user; however, it may (intheory) cause a denial of service to associated systems or networks if, forexample, --retry-delay is misinterpreted as a value much smaller than whatwas intended. This is not especially plausible because the overflow onlyhappens if the user was trying to specify that curl should wait weeks (orlonger) before trying to recover from a transient error.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-19909` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

curl - 7.68.0-1ubuntu2.19
libcurl3-gnutls - 7.68.0-1ubuntu2.19
libcurl3-nss - 7.68.0-1ubuntu2.19
libcurl4 - 7.68.0-1ubuntu2.19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: curl package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7.68.0-1ubuntu2.19').
